instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.Q9706: What is Q9706? Q9706 takes PPBUS_G3H's vltage and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q9706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R9788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q9706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 17 inch MacBook woth no water damage but physical damage i hear the chime and i light up the apple on the back with flash light to make sure is backlight issue and the computer is booting in OS. I check the F9700 was blown i replace it and after that <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR> got burned smoke came out. So i remove F9700 and started measuring i've noticed that <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is missing and when i follow that line takes me to <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> GMUX and i dont even know how this thing work. Any Ideas ???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: You have a short on the backlight output. Probably burned connector or cable. <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR> fried because you replaced the fuse with a wire or more than 3A.

threads.message: When i put wire on the fuse, computer wouldn't start anymore. I remove the wire and its working again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R9788</RESISTOR> Is 0.00001 ohms i got another that i measured 300k i put it on motherboard and I measure again and i still get 0.00001 ohm. Any ideas I'm getting crazy. haha

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R9788</RESISTOR> measuring short is because <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR> is dead. There is a short on the backlight output, measure it, who cares that connector and cable look good.

threads.message: I fix the backlight issue but now getting message "Your computer restarted because of problem. press power button to restart "
